intro: Jovibarba hirta subsp. borealis, commonly known as the Arctic hare's ear, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming structure with thick, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers during the short growing season. It thrives in rocky and sandy soils, often found in alpine and tundra environments. Due to its hardy nature, it is well adapted to cold climates and is considered a resilient species in its native habitat.
